intro: Knautia pseudolongifolia var. pinnatifolia, commonly known as the pinnatifoliate knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive pinnate leaflet arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its prolonged flowering period and ability to attract pollinators.
